snippet: The president-elect made the unsubstantiated claim as part of a storm of Twitter posts voicing anger about a three-state recount push....
abstract: Donald Trump makes baseless claim that he would have won popular vote as well as Electoral College were it not for millions of illegal ballots; daylong flurry of Twitter posts by Trump follows announcement by Hillary Clinton's campaign that it will participate in recount effort; outburst also comes amid growing internal rift in transition team over consideration of Mitt Romney for secretary of state.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MAGGIE HABERMAN
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York.

lead_paragraph: The president-elect made the unsubstantiated claim as part of a storm of Twitter posts voicing anger about a three-state recount push.

headline.main: Trump Claims, With No Evidence, That ‘Millions of People’ Voted Illegally
headline.print_headline: Trump Promotes a Baseless Claim on Illegal Voting
